com.konakart.appif

Interface FetchPromotionOptionsIf

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FetchPromotionOptions

    public interface FetchPromotionOptionsIf
    An object used to define options used when reading a promotion from the database

      • isOnlyReturnIfActive

        boolean isOnlyReturnIfActive()
        Only return the promotion if it is active. We check that it is set to active, within the configured date range and hasn't reached its max usage limit. Defaults to false.
        Returns:
        the onlyReturnIfActive

      • setOnlyReturnIfActive

        void setOnlyReturnIfActive(boolean onlyReturnIfActive)
        Only return the promotion if it is active. We check that it is set to active, within the configured date range and hasn't reached its max usage limit. Defaults to false.
        Parameters:
        onlyReturnIfActive - the onlyReturnIfActive to set

      • getSessionId

        java.lang.String getSessionId()
        Only used if the customer is logged in. Otherwise set to null.
        Returns:
        the sessionId

        void setSessionId(java.lang.String sessionId)
        Only used if the customer is logged in. Otherwise set to null.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - the sessionId to set

      • getCustomerId

        int getCustomerId()
        If the sessionId is set to null then the customerId should contain the id of the temporary user which is a negative number. The temporary user id can be used for evaluating expression rules.
        Returns:
        the customerId

      • setCustomerId

        void setCustomerId(int customerId)
        If the sessionId is set to null then the customerId should contain the id of the temporary user which is a negative number. The temporary user id can be used for evaluating expression rules.
        Parameters:
        customerId - the customerId to set

      • getCouponCodes

        java.lang.String[] getCouponCodes()
        Coupon codes to use. If none of the promotions require coupons, or you don't wish to test that the promotion is active then it should be set to null
        Returns:
        the couponCodes

      • setCouponCodes

        void setCouponCodes(java.lang.String[] couponCodes)
        Coupon codes to use. If none of the promotions require coupons, or you don't wish to test that the promotion is active then it should be set to null
        Parameters:
        couponCodes - the couponCodes to set
